description: From Late Latin perfunctōrius, from the past participial stem of perfungor, perfunct- (“perform, carry through”), from per- + fungor.

adjectives.description: perfunctory (comparative more perfunctory, superlative most perfunctory)

entries.meaning: Done only or merely to conform to a minimal standard or to fulfill a protocol or presumptive duty.
examples: Synonyms: automatic, cursory, obligatory, pro forma, token, unthinking

entries.meaning: Performed in a careless or indifferent manner as a thing of rote.
examples: He did a perfunctory job cleaning his dad's car, finishing quickly but leaving a few spots still dirty.
